thread.title: 17 men from Colombia arrested in burglaries targeting immigrant communities near Houston

author: John Boyd, Houston Chronicle
title: 17 men from Colombia arrested in burglaries targeting immigrant communities near Houston
text:
By John Boyd , Houston Chronicle Updated 10:10 pm, Thursday, January 26, 2017 Photo: Fort Bend County Sheriff Image 1 of / 18 Close Image 1 of 18

Photo: Fort Bend County Sheriff Image 18 of 18 17 men from Colombia arrested in burglaries targeting immigrant communities near Houston 1 / 18 Back to Gallery 
Seventeen men have been arrested in a string of burglaries authorities say are targeting immigrant communities in Fort Bend County. 
The arrests come after a year-long investigation by the Fort Bend County Sheriff's Office into a string of 120 home burglaries that the agency says targeted Asian, Pakistani and Middle Eastern communities. 
The FBCSO also collaborated with other agencies, including the Houston Police Department, to link burglaries with similar characteristics under those jurisdictions. From there, a three-month investigation was launched during which potential suspects were monitored 24 hours a day, according to a FBCSO. 
The 17 men whose arrests were announced Thursday each were arrested immediately following burglaries, according to FBCSO. 
All of the men are from Colombia. 
Four suspects in Fort Bend County Jail under ICE holds include: Carlos Alberto Riasco Valencia, 35; Layonel Mosquera Mondragon, 31; Harold Jesus Lerma Mosquera, 43; and Reynaldo Rivera Centeno, 44. 
One suspect, Jeferson Caicedo Perlaza, 36, also remains in the Fort Bend County Jail. 
The other suspects with cases in Fort Bend County are: Jhon Zamora Ibarguen, 26; Victor Sanchez-Murillo, 38; Miguel Gamboa Espinosa, 41; Jorge Johan Perea, Moreno, 27; and Marving Paredes-Arrechea, 34. 
The remaining seven suspects involved in cases in various jurisdictions include: Victor Alfonso Ayovi Cuena, 31; Hector Sinisterra, 34; Anderson Rosera Gamboa, 38; Mario Hurtado Galindo, 28; Andres Fong Luna, 38; Luis Hernando Mosquera Torres, 36; and Jhon Alvarado Riascos Valencia, 28.
